“Roe v. Wade turned 49, but we won’t see it turn 50 as it is,” said Students for Life of America President Kristan Hawkins. “Students for Life of America was founded as a Post-Roe organization, ready to protect life in law and in service in all 50 states. We’ve got a post-Roe plan, and we’re training the next generation of Pro-Life leaders to ensure that the children who will be born will have all our support.”
PHILADELPHIA, P.A., and WASHINGTON, D.C. (03-26-22) – TODAY, Students for Life Action / Students for Life of America President Kristan Hawkins will speak to participants in the 2022 Philadelphia March for Life. Hawkins will focus her remarks on the strategy for the Post-Roe America, the critical importance of the upcoming Pennsylvania gubernatorial race, and ongoing efforts to stop barbaric, taxpayer-funded research on Pennsylvania children.

“Roe v. Wade turned 49, said Hawkins, “but we won’t see it turn 50 as it is.” She continued: “Students for Life of America was founded as a Post-Roe organization, ready to protect life in law and in service in all 50 states. We’ve got a post-Roe plan, and we’re training the next generation of Pro-Life leaders to ensure that the children who will be born will have all our support.”
Pennsylvania is home to some of the most urgent battles for life. Among these is the University of Pittsburgh’s barbaric human experimentation on children killed in abortions. These experiments, funded by taxpayers, include scalping 5-month-old aborted babies and grafting their scalps on the backs of lab rats to see whether the rats could grow human hair.
Pennsylvania is also a key battleground state in the upcoming Midterm elections. In Pennsylvania, a Senate seat and possibly the governorship could flip from pro-abortion Democrat to pro-life Republican hands. In 2019, young pro-life advocates were accosted and threatened with doxing by Brian Sims, a state representative. Sims has since launched a bid for Lieutenant Governor of the state — a role in which his discriminatory and dangerous views would affect even more victims.

On Monday, Hawkins will travel to Montana where she will deliver an address entitled No Woman Stands Alone In A Post-Roe America at Rocky Mountain College, an event sponsored by Young America’s Foundation.
The Rally Will Take place at Noon at the end of the March route:
Independence Mall Visitors Center
599 Market StreetPhiladelphia, PA 19106

Students for Life Action (SFLAction), a 501c4, along with its 501c3 sister organization, Students for Life of America (SFLA), make up the nation’s largest pro-life youth organization and a political and policy operation engaging people of all ages. Together they work to end abortion — the human rights issue of our day — and provide political, legal, and community support for women and their children, born and preborn. Headquartered in Fredericksburg, VA, SFLA has more than 1,250 groups on middle, high school, college, university, medical, and law school campuses in all 50 states. SFLA creates strategy, policy, and programming to connect those most targeted for abortion with people ready to help and builds a framework for political engagement on their behalf. SFLA and SFLAction have more conversations with those most targeted by the abortion industry than any other pro-life outreach in the world, reaching more than 2 million people across social media platforms each week and engaging in approximately 100,000 digital conversations per month. Over the last 16 years, President Kristan Hawkins has grown SFLAction/SFLA into an $18 million organization preparing for a Post-Roe America.
